name: Kevin Chambers
text: When my AC died at about 3 AM on a Friday, I was NOT confident of being able to get it fixed before the weekend, much less replaced. Marvin (who I believe was the install team leader) and other men (who's names I missed) were back here and working by lunchtime! (And DONE by 5 PM). ALL T&S employees were polite and professional in every way. I've lived here for over 25 years and I really believe T&S set a new bar for residential service that I haven't seen in this town. Though I HOPE I don't see you folks at my house for a long time, I will recommend you to ANYONE needing heating & cooling work. Good job, and thank you.

As you can imagine, we were absolutely astounded that they could send someone out that same night to see what the problem was. Soon after Jack arrived, he was able to repair our A/C that same night, and we slept well knowing that our A/C was back up and running. Needless to say, we'll recommend Turner & Schoel to anyone and everyone that we know as they demonstrated what true customer service is all about.

To their credit they did fix the heat the technician said he serviced the unit and put half a pound of freon in it and didn't find a problem with it. Well my air conditioning isn't working now and I called them out again. This time the technician said it had a leak and needed fifteen pounds of freon. So it would cost me about $489 to have them repair it. So how did the unit get the leak? Their technicians are the only ones that have ever serviced the unit so apparently one of their own has done something or didn't do something between the two service calls.

text: Turner & schoel changed out a 4ton gas heat & AC. unit on my mom's house. 10000. Yes friends they ripped off my elderly mom and dad (80&85). These people are thieves. And tipoff attest. I now have proof of there thievery. I took a picture of the tag on this hamana.(Goodman) unit and took it around for estimates..... Hulsey 6700$..... Premier 7510$.... A1 Alabama 6450$.... Turner& Schoel. 8990$..... yes Turner and schoel bid the same 10000$ job 8990$. 1000$ cheeper than what they charged my mother.... by there own bid they are thieves..... but after talking to Bobby at A1.Alabama. they should have used them.... and as far as not being able to buy a hamana from Amazon. That's all you can buy from Amazon.  Goodman bought hamana in 1997. So dont be fooled by these fast talking con men thieves.... they are good at the con man fast talk. CON. yes you read this right. Mom paid 10000$. And they later bid the same job. 8990$ a full 1000$ cheeper witch is still 3000$ high... BEWARE THESE THIEVES.

resp.text:
Gary,

Your recent review has caused us great concern. I personally reached out to both of your parents to schedule a meeting and discuss their recent service in person. They assured me that they are completely satisfied with the system they selected and the service provided, and asked for assurance that we would continue to take care of their preventative maintenance. It will be our pleasure to continue working with your parents, as one of our highly valued customers.

I also wish to share with you that the system your parents purchased is not available on Amazon. The 16 SEER Amana system includes a 2-stage variable speed gas furnace. Both units come with a lifetime replacement guarantee, and the entire system is covered by a 10-year parts and labor warranty.

If you wish to discuss this matter further, please do not hesitate to contact us directly.

name: Michael Smelley
text:
First of all I would never buy a Trane unit. The experience I have had with this product has been a nightmare to say the least. Secondly, Turner and Schoel has done nothing, zero, nada in terms of helping me to be a satisfied customer with this piece of crap. After several years and several thousands of dollars (after my intiail investment) they finally said the coils needed to be replaced. This was another $3,600 last June. Replaced them with aluminum coils because they are suppose to be better and now one year and 3 weeks later I have a leak. Of course it is again out of warranty.

I have had another technician (from a much more reputable business) to come out and say that the unit was undersized and the duct work to two rooms was poorly done. If the only two companies in the world to make AC/heating units were Dynex and Trane and the only two companies in the world to install them were Turner and Schoels and WalMart I would have WalMart install a Dynex every day of the week.

name: A.J. Tosyali
text:
I have had several dealings with TS heating and cooling and most of which has been fair thanks to their previous manager Aubrey. I was always treated well by Aubrey and he always made me feel like an important customer no matter how little business I've previously done with them.

The last job they did for me was a follow up to trying to eliminate a drip sound that could constantly be heard in my bedroom anytime the heat came on. After several attempts, Aubrey felt badly enough that he said he was going to try something so miniscule that it may just work and he said he'd charge me nothing for it since they'd already charged me for a previous visit.

Well, they billed me for it anyway....not a big deal being $75 and given that I've paid them thousands over the last few years. However when I called the owner, Phillip, today he could have cared less about past business or future business and simply said that he was certain I was mistaken and I owed the money, as if I'd try to beat them out of $75.  I thought I was on candid camera based on the way an owner of a company could have cared less about one of his customers and the lecture he tried to give me about business. It was not worth the headache to fight over $75 but the way they made me feel and the fact that they would not honor a prior commitment was truly an unpleasant experience.

name: Bruce Mullins
text: I have had Farley and Hysaw install both residential and commercial HVAC systems. They have always done a great job and I was always billed timely and for the agreed amount. They helped to retrofit my older home with a mini split air conditioner in my upstairs which has been a life saver with the heat.

name: Adam Miller
text:
I had a leak in my ceiling caused by a leaking drip pan under my a/c.  Steve Hysaw came out personally after hours to inspect and fix the problem.  He said the pan would need replacing and scheduled a time for the replacement.  He even reduced the price by allowing me to help install the pan.

The problem was the billing.  I handed Steve a check for his overtime, afterhours visit on the day he came out.  I offered to pay the technicians when they came to install the new drip pan, but they said I would be billed.  After a week or two, I called the company to say that I had not received a bill and offered to pay by credit card over the phone but was told to wait until I got the bill.  Four months later, the bill arrived.  The first check had never been cashed, but was reported on the bill as a "bad check."  Also, the due date on the bill was the day before the postmark on the envelope.

These folks are good people who do good work but need help with their accounting and customer service.

name: Sandra Harpole
text: Thank you guys so much! Y'all rock!

name: Dave Strickland
text: Had a sun room added to our home and my contractor chose them provide the heating and cooling unit in August of 2016.  After the unit was installed there were a couple of things they needed to do to finish the job.  I called several times over the next four months speaking to a lady I assume is the receptionist and one time to Steve and informed her/him that I owed them for the unit and install. In January of 2017 I called again and informed them that I owed them some money for work started in August but not complete.  I told them as soon as they finished the install I would pay the money.  They came out finished the job and two weeks later I get a bill for more than the bid.  They do very good work but need to evaluate their accounting practices and improve on the customer service.

text: I booked a service call, via my home warranty provider, and once assigned, I contacted Myers to schedule the service appointment. He called ahead of time, was prompt, super friendly, courteous, and quick to answer any questions that I had. He had the unit diagnosed and repaired in WAY under an hour! I could not have asked for better service! Thank you, so much!!!

name: Vance Fleming
text: I have nothing bad to say about this company; they provide true quality service. The professional staff at Myers have been amazing. Through several visits of analyzing the problems, receiving the parts, discovering more in-depth issues then having a defective compressor shut the system down again, waiting for a replacement and installation of that part, we have had at least six visits. Each member was courteous, professional, spoke in layman’s terms and arrived within the four windows requested. I highly recommend Myers!

name: Brittney Lockhart
text: Professional, quick service and reasonable rates.

name: Jamal Williams
text: Awesome experience with this company. Drew was amazing very proffesional,  competent, and considerate. Came in and went right to work, once I explained what was going on. Figured out the issue, fixed it, inspected other areas with my system, and filled me in on it all. He wore a mask the entire time and was considerate enough to remove his shoes if needed.  Once again really great experience with Drew and this company. Definitely would request them again through American Home Shield and recommend them.

name: Erin Williams
text: Caleb, the Myers technician, was prompt and courteous. He explained what he was doing the entire time and was incredibly professional. At the end, he helped me understand the issue and how he fixed it and how to move forward if any issues occur after this. Thankful my house is cool now!

name: Jamie M
text: Employees were very quick and professional. Office was quick to respond back and get us scheduled for someone to come out. I would highly recommend this company to anyone!!

text: Myers was quick to respond to my issue but gave me a quote $2100 higher than another vendor. I am sure the quality of work is fine, but if your wallet is valuable to you too, shop around!

name: marco pendarvis
text: The three gentlemen that came out to do the initial inspection and then the installation were all very friendly and professional. They all called 30 minutes before arriving, which I really appreciated. Upon arrival they all identified themselves and explained as to why they were here. They all were very nicely dressed. The installers covered my carpet with a big drop cloth that they worked on and cleaned up all the debris that was made. Everything was left so nice and clean you couldn't even tell they were here. After they were finished they reviewed everything they had done and explained how the new equipment worked. Because of these three gentlemen, I'll feel very comfortable in calling on them and definitely recommending them to anyone else who might need their services.

They told me to call my home warranty so it was documented. They are super nice and honest. But I need to know,  Is this a normal set up with wires hanging all over the place?

Text messaging service is nice but I started receiving multiple unrelated junk texts after contacting the repair company the first time. That’s was the biggest inconvenience of the process.

We have always had fast, reliable, and courteous service from Myers!  We had issues after the recent hurricane and they got to us mid morning after the storm and had us fixed right up!

Very pleased with all our service appointments from them and all the guys were great!  Shout out to Colin and his staff for always looking out for us and getting to us as quickly as possible!

name: terrence frost
text: I feel like this could be a good company but with the shiesty buisiness practices I can not and will not recommend this company to anyone else.I am heated beyond belief about being charged for something that I did not break.I had a problem with my pressure relief valve so I called my home warranty company.They sent Myers and I agreed to pay the 375.We set the date.They showed up.I signed an invoice AGREEING TO PAY 375.The technician from Myers broke something after fixing what he was there to fix.Then turned around went and scratched out the 375and forced me to pay 500 for it.Then told me I signed an agreement to pay the amount on the invoice.Yea for 375.Not 500!The “manager” said there was nothing they could do and they wouldn't fix it unless I agreed to pay it.I called my home insurance company and they said to have Myers send them the invoice to see if I would have to pay for this extra service which would be crazy  seeing as this part wasn't broke until MYERS broke it.So after MYERS Fixes it...they bring me an invoice with BOTH totals on ONE invoice demanding I pay or they are going to cut the pipe back out of the ground and leave me and my wife and 4 kids without water.I talk to some manager labeled UNCLE "somebody"In the technicians phone and he basically bully's me into paying for some unfair repair.I feel like this is unjust and bad buisiness.I have never seen a company like this.They also came to fix on my air conditioning unit last year and told me I needed a WHOLE NEW $4000 system.And guess what...I didn’t!I called someone else and till this day I STILL have the same OLD system they tried to get me to replace.This company is crazy.No I won’t take my review down.No I will not cease and desist.And no I am not lying.

name: Santoria S Washington
text: I  filed a claim for my AC unit last Tuesday. Someone from Myers Comfort Specialist come out and determined it was our compressor. An appointment was set up for Wednesday between 10am -2pm. The technician came out and "replaced" the compressor, in which I paid $345 out of pocket for. My husband and I noticed that our home was HOT Thursday morning, so we called Myers back. A technician was sent out Saturday morning. She came at 8am. Stated she would be back by 11am in the heat of the day to see what was going on. At 1:30pm she had not returned. I called American Home Shield to update them because I'm concerned at this point. Not only is it my anniversary, but I have an one year old child as well. My home is 95 degrees. I was told there was nothing they could do. I had to contact Myers. Okay. I called Myers and spoke to a young lady with a disgusting and unprofessional attitude, who told me I had to wait, there was nothing she could do and it wasn't her problem. I explained to her we were expecting guest and I just needed an estimate time. She continued to be nasty and nonchalant. At 3:45am, the technician returned and stated  our compressor was "bad." My family and I had already lost a day of events and we were in a 95 degree house because we had to be there when the tech returned. I called American Home Shield back. Of course, they can do nothing about it. I was told the part store closed at 11am Saturday. NO one apologized for the inconvenience except Sabrina who works at Myers as a customer service representative. (I spoke to her after hours.) My family and I have been in a hotel for two nights at our expense. What an anniversary along with bad service and business! This morning I  received a call stating we will be seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm... ARE YOU SERIOUS????

name: Greg Hickman (greghickmanDOTcom)
text:
Poor 85 year old mother left on August 1st in middle of summer to sit in house for three days over weekend for a lazy tech. He was supposed to be there at 2pm but showed up at 5:30pm on a Friday. It was 92 degrees outside and her AC out since Thursday when she called. He said she needed a new thermostat wire and transformer and will be back Monday morning. It is Monday at 3pm and still not tech and 93 degrees outside. She had to stay inside due to COVID all weekend in record temps due to a $24 part he was too lazy to install or go get. All techs carry transformers on their truck...and her wire was fine but previous tech fixed it. The wire just looked rough but worked and he could have put a new transformer on there and saved her life. She is still locked inside afraid of COVID and people because some insensitive tech left her on Friday and all weekend on the hottest day of the year. I bet he would not have done that to his mother.

UPDATE

We called Monday and they didn't even have her on the schedule!!!!! The tech, Darrin, left her in 95 plus weather all weekend, lied about her needing a thermostat wire and then found out from the receptionist HE HAD THE PART on the truck Friday. He wanted to go home at 5:30pm Friday.......so Monday after a bunch of back and forth they came Tuesday and fixed it and two guys reran a new thermostat wire that was good but they wanted to replace since it looked rough.Keep in mind their tech Gage fixed our thermostat wire a month ago and was still working. So sad how one back tech, Darrin, can lie and put my mother with a hear condition at such grief and pain. I hope God is not merciful on his soul.

text: I've had Myers install a new AC, as well as work on two (we have 3 units). They have also installed a water heater as well as replacing our garbage disposal. They have always been on time and very professional.

name: Penelope Redlich-Stroik
text:
We unfortunately found Meyers to NOT be supportive of  costs for us as a CUSTOMER  as opposed to the cost to the HOME WARRANTY COMPANY - AMERICAN HOME SHIELD (AHS).
We do have a $100 fee for diagnostic work per contract with AHS.

The technician stated on the customer copy ‘yellow sheet’ that just a COIL was needed to be replaced.
So we would not have any further costs other than freon costs)
Instead, Meyers decided to submit a request to AHS to replace the handler as that would be the cheaper route for AHS.
Yes, cheaper for AHS, but would cost US additionally for the PLENUM, FLOAT, PAN, and MASTIC   amounting to an ADDITIONAL  $1210.
Meyers refuses to go back to what the technician indicated - replacement of coil.

If they had just sent in the charge for replacing the coil, iIT WOULD NOT HAVE COST US ANY MORE MONEY, other than replacement of Freon.

Does not seem very fair to the little guy!!!  Does it!  You decide!!

name: L.A. Stokes
text: As you would know it, Saturday night, temperature is in the 30's and my heating system goes out. I look up local and fast respond time and found Brothers heating and cooling. I'm prepared to hear we can't be there until Monday, the guy said yes ma'am, was at my house and had me warm as toast in less than an hour. Very courteous people, polite and made me feel at ease. Price was very reasonable, no extra hype because of the weekend, Brothers heating and cooling will be my go to for any hvac work! My heros!

name: Lane Johnson
text: December 31st, 2019 my unit was making a terrible noise.  We knew the unit was old and was on its last leg as it was.  Called them at 3pm and someone came out at 4.  Unit died, News yrs eve and it was cold with two young children in the house.  They gave a quote in which I thought was fair and came out News yrs day and installed a 4 ton York system. Showed up early both days and eager too work.  This is a start-up business and they are trying too build it.  Give these guys a shot to earn your business, glad I did.  Practically no heating and air conditioner company is ever going to come out on news yrs day.....except for these guys.

name: BJ Baker
text: Sam was very knowledgeable and courteous.  He took the time to answer a litany of technical questions and explained every detail of what he was doing.  Excellent service!  Thank you!!

resp.text: Hi BJ, thank you so much for sharing your experience with our technician Sam. We appreciate your feedback!

name: Bradley Wilkes
text: Super appreciative of the work the team did installing a cassette mini split in our home.  All my dealings with the Capital have been professional and pleasant and I will definitely recommend them to family and friends in the future!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review Bradley!

name: Jessica Stephens
text:
Giving 3 stars only because it is the average between the two components of service received.

Technicians/Product Installation - Five Stars! Over-the-top knowledgeable, courteous and timely!

Communication/Interaction with Jacob Oswalt - ZERO stars. Very snarky, condescending and entitled when he could have just been transparent. Followed through with the install only because our AC was already completely out.

New units work great and we are so happy it is done, but I definitely would not recommend this company.  Too many other reputable companies that are not such a pain to deal with.

resp.text:
Jessica,

I am glad you are happy with the installation. I am sorry the rest of your experience was not satisfactory. We did our best to work with you on an expedited schedule given your existing system was not operational. We were able to move you up from the original scheduled date to get your systems installed sooner. Most of our communication was after hours and over email, so I'm sorry if it came off as snarky or condescending as that was not my intention. Sometimes things get lost in translation over electronic versus verbal communication. I am glad the installation went well and that we were able to get your new systems installed in a timely manner. I apologize again for any misunderstanding or miscommunication and hope you will consider us in the future for your HVAC needs. Please let us know if you need anything else. - Jacob Oswalt

name: Mike vonEschenbach
text: Great response time when our generator was down, Eric was very professional and diagnosed and fixed our generator fast to get us power!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

text: Technician arrived on time. Courteous and polite. Used shoe booties when entering my house. Completed work in a timely manner. Payment either a credit card or check. And friendly to my dog.

name: Tony Nichols
text:
I recently used Capital Heating and Cooling to install a 22kw Generac generator at my home.  I was extremely pleased with the service I received.  Tommy Oswalt came out and did an initial site assessment and gave me a very realistic look at all the work necessary and the expense involved.

Once the generator arrived, technicians Ben House, Eric Gray and Colby Winham came out to pour a pad on the slope beside my house.   Because of the steep slope, they had to build a form to pour a slab for the generator to sit on.  Our generator was installed the next week and being in the service industry myself, I was very interested in each stage of the process.  The guys all did a fantastic job of making the installation look neat.  When Hoover inspectors came out to give their final inspection, it was apparent that they had worked with Capital Heating & Cooling often enough that they knew everything would be up to code and signed off on the job without a comment.

All the guys were very professional and did exceptional work.  The office staff also went out of their way to help make sure Spire followed through and installed a larger gas meter  (Thanks Laura)

I could not give Capital Heating & Cooling a better review. Job well done!😃

resp.text: Tony, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate your patience while we worked with Generac, Hoover Inspections, and Spire to get everything set up. We will pass your review on to our technicians as well! Please don't hesitate to give us a call if you need anything else.

name: Mark Williams
text: Capital Heating & Cooling replaced the A/C portion (indoor evaporator coils and outdoor condenser coils) of two Trane HVAC systems at my home, one for the main level and one for upstairs. I am very happy with their work. They took the step of identifying that the original pvc piping used for the drain for the unit in the attic was not draining effectively (a worker in the attic poured a gallon of water into it while another worker in the garage observed and noted the water did not make it to the drain in the garage) and they corrected that, mounting fasteners in multiple places along the PVC pipe to ensure it sloped properly in its run across the attic, and they replaced the rusted overflow tray beneath the HVAC unit. They also eliminated the traps in the drains for both units, which is where algae would always build up; the traps were apparently redundant because both drains feed into a drain in the garage floor that has a trap beneath the concrete floor. They left straight cleanouts in place of the p-traps which should reduce algae buildup, and I can still pour vinegar or chlorine to reduce algae. The three workers, Bobby, Jason, and Matt seemed trustworthy and very competent. The installation looks really well-done.

text: We’ve used Service Tech for our home and business since 1995. Our A/C unit reached the end of its life late on a Friday. We worked with sales, Steve Burns, who gave us numerous options for replacement. The installation technicians, Robert and Von, were incredibly professional and knowledgeable. We replaced both our A/C and furnace with Trane equipment. It’s completely solved our problem of hearing 2 floors with only 1 unit. The thermostat works from either the control pad or an app. Everyone in our family is really happy with the results and the service was outstanding!

Service Tech, Inc. really values your feedback and looks forward to continuing the great relationship that we have established over the years. Warm regards, Team Service Tech, Inc.

name: George Stewart
text: I had my two heating systems inspected and maintained by a Service Tech technician. He brought with him a new preventive maintenance system with temperature meters that attached to return and supply registers which would feed an analysis software app on his phone and prepare a report for me. I have not yet received this report but was told that my cooling systems were okay ( not sure why this was done this time of year). He also told me that my upstairs thermostat was not working properly in heat mode and thought it might need to be replaced. I pointed out to him that is recently replaced as new in June 2020 and said that it was installed by my son at that time. We looked at the installation and he discovered that a wire jumper that powers the heating mode was missing. After helping him by holding a light to illuminate the terminal strip, he installed the jumper and the thermostat heating system came on.

resp.text: Thank you George for your review.  We appreciate your business.  Please contact us if you have any other issues.

name: robert bashinsky
text: The work was good and results were satisfactory. The crew was to rip out the damaged duct work, replace it and clean the HVAC unit. This was done, but the only complaints I had were they did not cover the vents and returns before the removal of the old moldy ducts. Thus the rooms became full of a moldy smell. They did stop and come cover the vents and returns, but they did not have any painters tape to apply to the walls. Fortunately I had some painters tape to loan to them. Other than those two lapses I had no complaints. The foreman was courteous and helpful and I would use Service Tech again if needed.

resp.text: Mr. Bashinsky, we apologize that we failed to cover the vents and returns initially. We are fortunate that you loaned us your painters tape. Team work makes the dream work, right??! Our team will pass this information on so that we have all of the supplies we need in the future. Your feedback has been quite helpful and we look forward to a continued business relationship with you. Sincerely, Team Service Tech, Inc.

name: Kelsey Cunningham
text: DO NOT use this company! They were sent out through our home warranty 4 different times due to our unit never being fixed, it would work for a day or two then stop again and be 88-94 degrees in our home. Now, we have water damage as well and he poured the WRONG FREON and also overloaded it. We are now having to buy an entire new system out of pocket due to our home warranty sending companies like this out and fix water damage out of our pocket! Also, they are completely unprofessional. For example, the owner of this branch was the technician as well that came out and he proceeded to take his shirt off and “work” while there was only a young woman in the house!! He was not the fittest either, very disturbing. Also, he new we have a small child too and he wouldn’t come out until it was convenient for him and complained about it every time we had to call to set up an appointment AGAIN because he lived 45 minutes away. PLEASE DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!! (I don’t want to give them a star but it wouldn’t let me post this unless I did.)

resp.text: Your satisfaction is very important to us. We were not the first company and were not the last company to perform the multiple repairs for a world class home warranty that probably came with your new two bedroom home. Early 20's, gone through a divorce, very hard time, baby, then these multiple repairs before and after us. Glad you at least remembered us. But remember we fixed several issues before the next guys.

The unit had a problem to reoccur and Robert came back out and fixed the problem without charging me. He even recommended another warranty company for me to use .I definitely would recommend this company plus Robert returnrr my calls or texts at his earliest convenience. text: My air went out  on a Friday night. I called my warranty company and they had me for another company that would not be available until Monday. He told me that he would look at the schedule and see can he get a tech out later that afternoon or early Sunday.  I received a call from Tech Robert  within an hour of speaking with Mr. Bo. Robert took his time explain the problem and fixed it each issues. I must say I am very please with the services that has been render. The level of professionalism that was GREAT!

name: Bo Atkinson
text: My AC unit had been performing quite poorly in recent weeks, and after looking into various service providers around Birmingham, I decided to call BoJIFFY. I could not be more satisfied with the service Bo provided! Bo answered my phone call after only 2 rings at 7:30 AM, and was able to diagnose the issue with near certainty. I asked if Bo could arrive to work on my AC at noon, and he arrived at 11:59. Sometimes my watch runs a little slow, so he likely arrived at exactly 12:00. I would highly recommend BoJIFFY to anyone in need of air conditioning service – Bo is a top-notch professional!

resp.text: Like we say, If your air condioner is iffy, call Bo Jiffy!

text: Always on time if not early. Very dependable service. Always courteous and professional. Highly recommend for any of your heating and air needs.

name: rutbuster1
text: I've been a customer with Barrett Heating and Air for 15 years. Anytime my old unit would have trouble they'd come out and fix it right. Well, my old unit finally gave up after 15 years of service during our recent cold snap in February. So I called Barrett Heating and Air. They came out and said they could fix it, but price wise and warranty wise, it would be cheaper just to get a new unit. With the age of my unit, I agreed. They installed a new unit and it's working flawlessly. What I like about their staff is that they're honest, courteous, committed, and will answer any questions you might have. And that's either in person, phone, or internet. They've always been straight up with me on prices, solutions, and recommendations. They don't try to rip you off. They give you options and let you decide without any pressure. I respect that a lot. Plus, in most cases, if there is a problem, you can get same day service. Their techs are top notch and know exactly what they're doing. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this company.

name: Nathan Forrest
text: I got three estimates and Barrett was the lowest. I even asked about a more efficient and expensive unit and was told the extra money I would spend would not really be worth it in the long run. They installed a quality unit. The nice lady at Barrett even called me after the installation and informed me about a rebate I was eligible for through Spire. I ended up getting $300 back from Spire. I could not be more pleased with my choice of Barrett.

name: Mir Ali
text: I hate to be the one to post a bad review for this company as they’ve had very positive comments over the years. However, the work I recently had done on my property was supposed to cost me $478 based on the quote that was provided to me by the property manager. I was given this in writing. Once the job was completed, I was charged $853! That’s almost double the quote. I can understand a slight increase in the final price but this is simply unwarranted. If this is their normal business practice, I don’t understand how they’ve managed to continue to operate…and receive positive reviews.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear you did not have a good experience with us. We feel there may be a miscommunication with this issue and would like the opportunity to make it right by you; please call us at 334-285-0014 at your convenience so we may resolve it. Thank you, Brandon Barrett, Owner

text: This was an inside and outside unit.  (Heat pump) my full name is Betty B Herrington.  He gave us a military discount which took several hundred dollars off our cost. name: Danelle Stokes
text: AJ came out to service my unit for the summer and he told me that there was an issue with the area where the unit is because of exposed air flow. He also recommended the APCO X purifier. He came back a couple of days later and fixed all of the exposed air flow and installed the APCO X and my ac is working 100% better thanks to him. He was on time and very professional. I highly recommend AJ!!

text: AJ did an excellent job installing our new HVAC unit.  He was very knowledgeable and corrected a problem we had with the air flow.  I would recommend him to anyone, you won't be sorry!!!

name: suzanne austin
text: Calvin Air came to our rescue twice in less than a year!  The second time, without hesitation, we entrusted AJ to replace our unit.  He came out, diagnosed the problem, and the NEXT day we had a brand-new system in place!  He gave us honest opinions about the different systems that we could install, he measured and calculated to make sure that the bigger ton system would work for our house, and he stood by his military discount-on both visits-which ultimately saved us hundreds of dollars!  He also remedied everything that hindered optimal performance in our old system (in the handler closet) to ensure that the new one would work properly.  His punctuality, extensive knowledge, attention to detail, and above all his honesty is everything we look for when being provided a service.  Bottom-line, Calvin Air has gained a loyal customer for life!

resp.text: Thank you so much for that review! :)

name: Ivey Welch
text: Hansen's heating and air tried to rip me off for 1200. Mr Calvin came over, identified the actual problem, repaired the unit and cleaned it up all for under $300. I will only use him from here on out. He knows what he is doing, he is honest and fair.

text: Very satisfied with service—guys very professional & friendly—would recommend to everybody

name: Nathan Harrison
text: Calvin came out on a Sunday to repair my 80 year old mother's air condition. She had been given the run a round from another company who had made three service calls and charged her for service call fees and equipment replacement she did not need. Calvin inspected the unit thoroughly and test all components to find it only needed freon. I will never use anyone but Calvin Air for all my family from now on. Honest and professional. He explains every detail of what he is doing and in away you can understand. Truly the best air conditioner company ever. Give him a call you will be glad you did.

name: Juan Puente
text: I’ve said this before and I’ll say it again. I’ve never met someone so Genuine and down to earth as Calvin! We were in a rental property and our ac went out! Landlord called and said repair man was on the way. Literally within 30 minutes or less Calvin was here. Came in with a warm greeting and went to work. Found the issues and put in a replacement part for the night (had to pick up the new part in the am). Landlord decided he wanted to replace the whole outside unit and the next day Calvin was back to the rescue. Only had us down for not even a couple of hours I do believe. Chit chatted a bit before he left. I will always have him in mind whenever we cross over into homeowners and when family and friends ask for an ac repair man! Thanks again Calvin for everything! It was truly a pleasure meeting you!!

name: John White
text: I would NOT recommend Eagle Service for plumbing. They replaced a portion of our sewer pipe in our basement that we had been having clogging issues with. The new piping looks excellent and the problem seems to have been fixed. However... I had a couple of issues. They charged me an extra $150 for a 2nd visit that only took 10 minutes for him to confirm the issue (I believe this was refunded after I complained). And worst of all, he did not protect the work area and raw sewage dumped all over our washer and dryer, mop sink, basement walls, etc. I did not see this happen and it ended up being much worse than I thought. I asked him if he was going to clean up before he left, he didn't even sweep up the PVC dust from cutting the pipe. He asked me if I had a mop?? All he did was hose down the area and did NOT do a thorough job cleaning up the raw sewage or disinfecting the area. When I called the office to talk to a manager, they told me they have gotten calls before but that it was not standard for their crew to carry cleaning supplies on their trucks. They did not offer to send someone to clean up the mess. The Servpro quote was twice as much as the plumbing quote. I truly cannot believe they would leave someone's home in such a mess. It's a good thing it was in an unfinished basement!

name: Susan Johnson
text: My furnace quit working the day before a predicted freeze warning! I called OnTime Service and they actually told me that the first available appointment was December 9th.  So I got in touch with Eagle Service Company and David was here the same morning I called. This company is a fourth generation company founded in 1930. John Jeffcoat, the owner, was actually an Eagle Scout and his core values are based on what he learned as a Boy Scout!! David found the problem, replaced the broken part, and heat began to blow! He was professional, knowledgeable, and efficient! If I could give more stars I would! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Nicky Hobbs
text: Eagle Service Company was dispatched to our home to find an exterior leak and restore our water service.  Their people were very courteous and diligent.  They located the source of my leak, evaluated the best way to restore my service and completely repaired everything.  The best thing I like about Eagle is they take ownership.  I knew they were going to be with me from start to finish to make sure I was happy and extremely satisfied, which I am.  Very well done!  They get my highest recommendation.

text: I called Eagle on a Friday afternoon since we had a drain problem before a busy weekend at my Laundromat. Brian showed up a couple hours later and saved our weekend business. I think there prices are very fair and would recommend the company and Brian for your pumbling needs.

name: Terry Bost
text: Eagle Service Company came to my home on 7/13/2020 to install a dishwasher, sink, faucet, and disposal. They left and they had damaged the wiring to the dishwasher and it would not run. The company told me the next day to read the user’s manual and call an appliance repair company to come fix it. There is a 28 day warranty on their work. They damaged the wiring to the dishwasher, and I now have to call an electrician to come fix their damage.

resp.text: We installed an owner furnished dishwasher and reconnected the existing electrical wiring.  When we returned to see why the dishwasher had stopped working, we discovered a loose wire in the junction box below the dishwasher.  The dishwasher was operating properly when we left.  We offered to pay to have the homeowner's electrician look at the wiring and correct the existing electrical connection if necessary.  We apologize for the inconvenience.

name: Brian Dudas
text:
Cannot speak to actual service but was quoted $600 for a simple part change under warranty. This would be for labor alone. When asked why so much for a job that should take 1 man less than an hour, I was informed they have a 4 hour minimum fee. This was after already paying a $70 diagnostic fee just to get in the game.  Sorry but this is not an acceptable business practice in the service industry, and rather dishonest. I wish them the best.
Edit: In response to you, Sir, thank you for the specific details. Very informative, and highly technical. Doesn't change the fact that you're charging 4 hours labor (at a very high hourly rate) for something that takes far less than that to do. I can describe many processes in such detail that sound impressive but in all actuality are very rapidly executable tasks. The job as you described can be completed by others in less than an hour. I'm sure your techs do fantastic work, but you should warn customers of your unreasonable rates before you demand a $70 diagnostic fee that leaves a customer empty handed. Again, all the best.

resp.text: The replacement of this part is not a simple one. To do this job the right way, we have to pump down the system and hold the freon in the outdoor unit. Not all of the freon will hold in the outdoor unit. We will have to recover the freon that is left in the system. Then unsweat the txv at the evap. coil with our torches and sweat the new valve back in.Fill the system up with nitrogen to check for leaks, pull a vacuum on the system and wait until the system is pulled down to 500 microns. After this is finished we wait another 30 mins to make sure again that there isn't any leaks. Once we make sure there are no leaks we turn the freon loose from the outdoor unit and check the freon levels to get the sub cooling to the manufacturer's specs. Thank you for your review and we are sorry you were not satisfied with the price given but we take pride in our technicians work and making sure our customers and their systems are taken care of the right way.

name: Jon Cotton
text:
SOLID!!!!
Service Air has been servicing our two units since we've lived in Daphne (2015).  They came highly recommended after we had to dismiss another company for price gouging labor cost.  Recently they came to my house for service and pointed out some leaks during a bi-annual service and recommended I make a home warranty claim.  I made claim and a Home Warranty A/C contractor (not Service Air) came out and stated I needed new air handler and compressor.  Home Warranty A/C contractor (not Service Air) also tried to charge me a TON of uncovered cost. I contacted Service Air and reviewed my cost.  Service Air agreed to help me out for a entire new unit instead of piece by piece repairing my upstairs unit.  Along the way, Glen saved me money by explaining why I didn't need some systems, but would be better off with other.  All of Service Air's techs were highly professional and courteous.  Thanks a 2.5 ton to Service Air and all their techs for a great job.  I will be sticking with them and highly recommend them for your AC/H needs.

resp.text: Hi Jon, thank you for the positive review and recommendation. We pride ourselves by doing what's right by our clients and we're glad you experienced that. We hope you're enjoying your new unit!

name: Gina Eudy
text: We had the worst experience ever with this company. We bought a new unit and it didn’t work as soon as the installers left. We called them back several times to correct the problem and it has been improperly installed the entire time! We had a huge water leak this past year and had to vacate our home for a month. The owner accepted full responsibility when he saw the air handler wasn’t even installed right. My insurance company had already been contacted at that point so they paid the claim minus our $1000 deductible. Now Service Air Eastern Shore have changed their minds and decided they weren’t going to accept liability anymore. So, we are out our deductible and our insurance premiums have already went up $1000 this year. Very disappointed with this company’s customer service and the unqualified installers.  They had an opportunity to do the right thing and didn’t.

resp.text: We replaced your old inside unit on 5-16-2016. At this time we recommended replacing your outside unit. You declined. On 3-23-2017 you had us replace your outside unit. Your system performed normally. On 5-30-2019, 3 years after the inside unit was installed, the drain line clogged up. Your other AC system, which sits adjacent to this system in the attic, had recently been replaced by another company. We found the drain lines had been disconnected. We corrected this problem and added two new safety switches to your drain and pan. Your insurance company contacted ours and had the event investigated. The insurance company determined that Service Air was not at fault. Your system was installed correctly and we never said otherwise.

Update 06/04/19: My ac unit finally bit the dust for good on a late Saturday evening, of course, and I immediately thought of Service Air. We called them at 8 am the next morning, they were here by 10:30 am, and we had a completely new heating and air system at a very reasonable price by 7 pm that same evening. I cannot recommend this company highly enough. They have unbeatable customer service, great employees, and do quality work at affordable prices. text: I called to get an estimate done. The lady took my information and said someone would call back and schedule a time to come out. Well guess what? They never did, so I took my business elsewhere. Very unprofessional and rude to wait around for them to call back.

text: They do awesome work in a timely manner. Their employees are respectable and dispose of their trash properly, or take it with them. Repeat customer.

name: John Dumoulin
text: I've used Moore's now for about the past 5-6 years, for several personal and estate properties I manage. AC repairs are rarely cheap to start with and today's Puron systems and selection options of sizes and SEERS don't make the options any easier to understand.  Moore's seems to takes it all in stride, providing quick, clear estimates. They have been fair and easy to work with (I now live out-of-state). Most importantly to my tenants, they arrive when they say they will. More important that that, I guess, is that they've fixed the problem every time, the first time.

name: Mark Moore (Born2BKing)
text: I am a General Manager of a restaurant in the Huntsville area and I use Moore's regularly. They always find a fix for equipment in my restaurant and other than one occasion they are always out to service my equipment in a timely manner. I would recommend their services to others commercial or private.

name: Gil Olive
text:
Had them come out to fix a blower fan which is very simple work.  4.5 hours later they finally get done putting on the new motor (I could have done it in that time) and it sounds like a helicopter taking off when it runs because they forgot to balance the blade after putting it back on the new motor.  Moore's charges a labor rate ($75/hr) for their guys to drive to your house, drive to get parts, and talk on the phone which is ridiculous.  They charge the labor rate for every second their on your job, which is not industry standard (they'll try to convince you it is).  This means if the guy has to wait in line at the parts warehouse, your getting charged $75/hr.  If he has to drive 30 minutes from his last job to yours, your getting charged $75/hr.  On top of it they charge a $10 gas fee on top of charging a labor rate for their guys to just drive around.  The keyword here is "Labor". (which means turning screws, not waiting in line)  It took Moore's $420 in labor to replace a $100 fan motor.

I've been told by many people now that White Refrigeration is the way to go.  They don't charge a labor rate to go get parts.  They only charge the labor rate while they're actually turning bolts and wrenches, which is the way it should be.  They have a cheaper labor rate and don't charge for travel time, parts fetching, etc.

This is all on top of the fact that Moore's charged 30 min more labor than they were supposed to and didn't refund us the money.  They basically told me (the customer) that I was wrong, even though my wife was at home and watched how often he came and went.  He was there 4 hours but Moore's told me that we got charged 30 minutes more for the time it took him to get to our house from his last job which isn't right.  These guys are crooks and they have the worst customer service I've ever seen.  I called to dispute the 30 minute discrepancy and the owner (Moore) hung up on me.

AVOID THESE GUYS LIKE THE PLAGUE AND GO WITH SOMEONE ELSE.  THEY ARE USED TO COMMERCIAL WORK WHERE THEY CAN CHARGE OUT THE WAZOO AND GET AWAY WITH IT.  AND ON TOP OF IT, MY UNIT IS STILL NOT FIXED.
They still haven't fixed my ceiling, was told i would hear from dry wall man..it's been 4 months

text: Overall I had a very good experience. I would definitely recommend them to friends/family in the future. They came out on a Sunday to repair our unit that had stopped blowing cool air. The only suggestion I would have is the number that’s listed to call, maybe make it more clear what times there will be someone available to take a call after hours. The website says the business is open “24 hours” which I imagine that’s because they take emergency calls. But, I had to call that number about 5 times within a couple hours to get someone on the phone. But, once I did it was a very pleasant experience they took care of my request immediately and very friendly. I work in a customer service roll, so that’s very important as you’re very much the face or the voice of the company.
