All this could of been avoided if they would simply offered a simple SORRY. But no one wants to take ownership of their actions. Then Hannah in customer service asked me to stop yelling at her while I was having a conversation , with phone on speaker, haven’t disrespected her nothing and she stops me to tell me stop yelling. Instead of trying to understand the message I’m trying to get her to understand , she is asking me to lower my tune when it wasn’t in a disrespectful manner and I told her that several times.  It’s not like they are doing us a favor, WE ARE PAYING CUSTOMERS. I would not recommend. Spread the word

name: John Hosmer
text:
For a long while there have been atmosphere issues in our basement where the previous home owners had never taken care of sealing up the rooms and keeping temps and humidity in check. We had addressed those issues and we had tried using good filters at the returns to prevent as much of any dust, mold spores, etc. from recirculating and spreading, but it ended up being a losing battle for both comfort and our family's health.  Finally, about a month ago I disconnected one of the flexpipes at the end of the trunk run to see just how bad it was and found almost 100% coverage of dust, mold, and nastiness throughout the system. It was in every bit of the trunk, and every flexpipe throughout the house (See pictures). Even a few of the vent registers had started harboring mold growth which was a really bad sign as well.

So, I did what any good panicking homeowner would do at that point. Went to Google, pulled up nearby HVAC companies with good reviews that could do duct replacement, and called for appointments for onsite inspections. Out of the four highly reviewed and reputable companies (minus individual contractors) in the Pelham area that actually showed up for their appointment, Autumn Air's rep Baker was the only one who showed up on time, actually visually inspected inside the ductwork even after I showed him the initial pictures I took, and then spent a solid amount of time explaining to me options for replacing the entire ductwork system so we could see about what would be right for our budget. In the end, the price that Autumn Air was able to provide for an upgrade to a new round smooth metal interior and outside insulated wrapped system, including new boots and registers, throughout the entire house, plus a new central AprilAire Space Guard filtration and iWave-R GPS ionization system upgrade (per my request) beat out the one other company who actually sent me a quote by almost half. Let me say that again differently...TWO of the four companies NEVER sent back a quote. This told me that two of the highly reputable companies in the Pelham area that have a high amount of favorable reviews simply did not want a job. Pitiful for them.

Fast forward to the install a week later...Led by two guys named Javy and Charles, they took care of making sure everything was treated with care when taking out the old ductwork so as to minimize spreading of dirt and mold as much as could be. Then, they proceeded to assemble and install all of the new system on site for custom fitting plus making sure all seams were taped properly and coated with mastic so that the chances of air leaks past the coils is forever kept at a minimum. They arrived early in the morning, and worked until the job was finished that evening (on the day of Harvey storms coming through too!).  Any questions I had concerning anything with the job was answered and explained with no hesitation on their part.  They went beyond expectations with accommodations and I just can't be any happier.

I can't say it enough in this entire description here how great Autumn Air is for an HVAC company. They want someone's business in the best way because they give the work the best service they can at reasonable prices, and offer great financing options too if needed. They understand how to go the extra mile to make sure the customer is being taken care of in the end as well. I can say I have also had the pleasure of meeting Jeff, the owner, later when he came back to look at a minor issue that crept up post install, and he is just as awesome about discussing more than the "here's what we'll do". He takes the time to explain the why and how's (if you are interested to know and ask) and will work with you as a customer to do everything he can within reason to make sure you are satisfied with him and his company. Because of all of these things described about everyone at that company and how we were treated, we now not only have clean, sanitized fresh air, but the confidence to know it will stay that way due to the complete service and professionalism we got from Autumn Air.

name: Bryan Pope
text:
So thankful for Jeff and his team. So professional, helpful, informative, and efficient. We called the night our air conditioner went out, Jeff came that night to offer options and quotes, then they arrived and installed the very next morning. They had the air on by lunch and completed modifications by dinner. Jeff considered our concerns and needs, then offered multiple options to meet both. Leaps and bounds above the competition. They made sure everything was properly set up and running as efficiently as possible before leaving. They even cleaned up after themselves. I highly recommend, especially if you have an out of date unit and and want to reduce your power bill. Fresh, Clean, Crisp Air all thanks to Jeff and his team.

Description of work:
Heat Pump and Air Handler Replacement - increased from 4ton unit to 5ton unit - duct work modifications to accommodate increase. Original construction of our home, 12 years ago, was  rushed and the a/c and duct work was thrown together quickly and in a sloppy manner. Our duct work was constricting air flow and in need of modifications. Our power bill was astronomical. So we called Autumn Air.

name: Max Levi
text:
Autumn Air (Charles in particular), have been absolutely incredible!  My existing furnace kept cutting off in the mornings, but then it ran fine for most of the day.  It was a difficult thing to track down, and they never quit troubleshooting to get to the root of the issue so they could fix it the right way.

This took several trips, they tried several things, one at a time, to narrow it down.  Instead of changing a bunch of things or applying "band-aids", they worked hard to pinpoint the true issue.  It ended up being a piece of metal (limit) that was popping and shutting it off prematurely (before the heat limit actually occurred).  So a tiny faulty limit had to be found, and they found it.

It took a lot of patience and tedious work at times.  They just had the attitude of "I'll find the root cause no matter what it takes, and I won't stop until I find and fix it."  I truly believe others would have given up or chalked it up to an issue with my new thermostat.

I really appreciate the time and effort that was put into troubleshooting, not giving up, and finding the real issue, and fixing it the right way!

name: Deidre Stone
text: We built our house just 3 Summers ago. During that 3 years it seems like either 1 unit or the other was in a struggle and the builder's installer was at my house at least every 6 months. It just never did heat or cool correctly and ran what seemed like constantly. You can imagine my frustration in a new home. This spring we called Autumn Air. They came right out and checked everything. They even went into the attic and found an issue with a clogged drain. (which the other guys never did) The air has been so cold all Summer that we can't set it under 74 without getting a chill and my power bill is HALF of what it has been in the past! Here we are 4 months later and my technician, Baker, gives me a courtesy call to just see how things are going since the service. I can't say enough good about these guys! Affordable, professional, and quick! I won t call or recommend  anyone but Autumn Air going forward!!Thanks for taking the stress out of my Summer!

text: I have been with a different local HVAC company for the past 4 years. I had been content with them and their service until I had a repair. I had a capacitor go out and I was charged over $300 to replace it. I didn't think much about it until I shared my story with a few people who know what they are talking about. Turns out it was a steep price! I lost TRUST and confidence with them for work. I heard Autumn advertising on WDJC and thought I would check them out. Their monthly maintenance program is very reasonably priced and I even quizzed them on how much a capacitor replacement would run...much more reasonable! So I made the switch and scheduled my first maintenance visit...next day I might add and not in 6 weeks like the other. I was once again shocked at how bad my other service companies quality of work was for maintenance as Charlie showed me all of the stuff that wasn't being done! So, I am very happy I made the switch and hopeful that I have a company I can trust!

name: Lee McCarty
text: Our air conditioner decided to break down late Friday night, so I found myself in the position of trying to find someone to come out on Saturday to fix it. After calling numerous other companies that were in my area, each time just being told they had no available service time except later in the week, (none of them even asked exactly what the unit was doing, or what was wrong). I found Autumn Air online, and even though they weren't in my area, I figured I had nothing to lose trying them. My call was answered professionally, and he took my info and told me that they were pretty full for the day, but that they would try to fit me in. He asked me for details on what was wrong. After about 10 minutes, he called me back saying that they had a cancellation and a tech could be. at the house in about an hour. An hour later the tech was here and within 30 minutes we had cool air!!! I want to thank Autumn Air for taking the time to talk to me and for fitting me into their busy schedule on such a hot Saturday. The price was VERY reasonable, especially considering that it was a Saturday in the busy Summer season. I would recommend this company to everyone I know!

text: We went with them about a year ago and they did a decent job but not this time. We had absolutely no air in 90 degree weather. Late Friday no call, no text. I called and left a voice mail letting them know. Monday still no call so I called them again. We left another voice-mail. At this time we decided to call another company who scheduled us in as an emergency since it was so hot outside. It is now Wednesday and we have yet to get a call back from this company and our air is running beautifully thanks to the other awesome company we went with. My problem isn't the fact that they may have been too busy and couldn't see us this week,, my problem is the fact they couldn't call and let us know at any time in the past 6 days when the weather has been over 90 degrees in the house.

text: The technician was polite and competent enough for the job. He replaced a leaking outdoor faucet. The COST WAS EXCESSIVE. This company uses a notebook with a printed price list. The technician spent less than 20 minutes and the cost was $577.  He left the old faucet laying on the ground. I regret that I agreed to the job.

resp.text: Hi Cindy, thank you for your honest feedback. Input like yours helps us take steps towards improving as a company. We are sorry to hear the cost of our services didn't meet your expectations. We provide upfront pricing before the job begins so there are never any surprises. We also pride ourselves on cleanliness and picking up after each job - so we sincerely apologize for the faucet that was left behind. Please know we will be addressing each of your concerns with the management team, but we'd also love the chance to speak with you directly. Please call us at your earliest convenience: 205-942-1405

name: Fred Patterson
text: OnTime Service is a great electrical contracting company.   Most of my experiences with contractors on the Eastern Shore have been pretty mediocre at best.   OnTime Service was a refreshing change.   They are a well established Birmingham based company that just recently branched out to Baldwin County.   They took my call immediately (unlike the other 3 electricians that never called back) and the next day an electrician showed up to install the transfer switch for my house generator.   It was pretty clear the technician was very skilled and was very pleasant to work with.   They have a preset price book, which matched what I was expecting for cost.   If you need a competent electrician that cares about customer service, give these folks a call.

text: I gotta say these guys are awesome. They’ve now installed two new AC units in two different houses for us. Each time, they were genuinely empathetic to fact that nobody’s having a good day when their AC breaks, and were more than fair in pricing. Yesterday, they came out to do annual service on that last AC unit, and their tech spent almost a whole extra hour with me - for FREE - to walk me through a water heater installation I was trying to do myself and was kinda in over my head on. The whole reason I opted to do that job myself was that one plumber quoted me $2k, and OnTime Service wanted $179 just to come out and offer a quote (no thanks). Needless to say, I trust Ethridge and would def recommend them.

name: David Sherrill
text:
I can't say enough good things about Ethridge. We have had to replace both of our units in our house over the last two years. During our most recent one, we had a small issue and they quickly sent someone out to fix it. When we had a problem with the older of the two units, they, again, quickly got someone on site to both fix the issue, and do a thorough investigation of both our units.

You know the quality of any company starts at the top and the is true here as well. Mr. Ethridge is such a great guy. He employs people like Daniel who is one of the nicest and most conscientious service people I've ever met.

So, if you need a new unit, service on your current unit, or just looking for someone to perform maintenance, I HIGHLY recommend Ethridge! They may not always be the absolute cheapest, but you do get what you pay for in this type of work. They are worth every penny!

text: In a span of about 3 weeks fighting the AC and the home warranty company, my wife and I were really getting disheartened about just moving into our first home. We dealt with two separate AC companies with no avail before contacting Ethridge Heating and Air. Once I did, they made the process incredibly simple and stress free. They seemed to really care and were punctual with the install. Now, thanks to them, we are able to enjoy our new home and worry about the fun stuff about making a house a home. In my opinion there's only one HVAC company worth dealing with, and they now have a customer for life, Ethridge Heating and Air. They'll fix it FAST!

text: Very professional and knowledgeable technicians. Installation of our new upstairs system went smoothly and was finished relatively quickly. I probably could have gotten cheaper service elsewhere, but I'd be hard pressed to say that I could have gotten better.

text: I called at 7:30 a.m. to have my to have my AC checked out, it started blowing warm the night before. Two technicians were at my house by 11:00 a.m. and had my unit diagnosed and fixed in 40 minutes. They replaced a faulty capacitor for a very fair price. Everyone was very professional and friendly. I highly recommend Ethridge.

name: sqlb3rn segfavlt
text:
Nice folks, absurd prices, had to call them back out on 2 separate occasions because the tech didn't finish the job. Got charged more money of course. Check around before you commit to thousands of dollars, I'll be using a different company from now on.

Edit: was quoted $710 to install a new fan blade and $1300 for a new fan motor. I bought a OEM fan blade online for $38 and installed it myself in 10 minutes. The motor is perfectly fine. Enjoying cold AC again after a 3 day wait for shipping. I don't know how they get off charging that much, I think they just want people to finance repairs.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback. We would love to resolve any issue but we can’t tell who you are based on the anonymity of your Google username. We take pride in our work, our pricing, and the handling of any customer concern. Nearly every customer that does a large job with us, shops around, does their homework, and in the end, hires us to do the work. The process goes smoothly, and everyone is happy. We apologize for whatever has caused you to feel differently and would like to resolve any concern fairly. So if you wouldn’t mind, please make yourself known to us as we had no idea there was an issue until now. You can do that here, or feel free to call our office to begin resolving whatever it is that concerns you. We’d love to help, but we don’t know who you are. If this is a true concern and this is not a case of you reviewing the wrong company, all you need to do is call to resolve. We are more than fair and will work with you to resolve your concern. Thanks!

They offered a great price, warranty, and were respectful to my family- including our nosey pup that followed them around. We highly recommend Ethridge Heating and Air.

name: Andi Friel
text:
Wonderful customer service, friendly & knowledgeable technicians! Owner is very engaged in his company, and it shows! I called one evening and he answered the phone himself, personally taking care to assess my needs & book my appointment for the next day. Our job ended up being a big one! Super quick response and 2 crew installation of our new units (2 outside units, furnace and condenser in basement, plus one condenser in attic). Definitely recommend and we will continue using them for our HVAC needs!!

Unfortunately, they used RedBrick Financial Group for financing when we purchased our units, and RedBrick was awful to deal with! Shady practices, extremely rude “customer service”, no transparency in billing, difficult to make payments, and will put a lien on your home without notice or authorization. Stay away from RedBrick!
****Very glad to see (on Ethridge H & A website) that they NOW use Wells Fargo for financing! We have used WF for multiple banking accounts & they are very transparent and payments are easy to make in multiple ways.*****

text: There’s no other HVAC company id rather use, than Ethridge. Their technicians are always kind, knowledgeable  and prompt.  Daniel recently came out to my house and Ethridge should be happy to have him as a representation of their company. Highly recommend.

text: Andrew with Ethridge heating and air was awesome. He was on time, friendly, and wasn’t bothered when I asked him a thousand questions about what he was doing. The appointment scheduling was easy and the cost was very reasonable to get my AC unit going again.

name: James Moore
text:
Die to aedical emergy I needed something  done sooner and not later.  I contacted one company and Mon was the earliest .  Called Etheidge and explained my deljima on Friday nite and a service tech was here sat when  they said they would be here. sat morning.  A/ C suppliers atre closed on weekends but Mr Ethridge was able to secure the needed equipment for the job.   The installers worked all day Sunday installing the new system. Mike Moore

text:
I called Etheridge after hours and spoke to Jamie the owner.  He was very helpful and was spot on with the diagnosis of my unit over the phone. Technician Jarrod was dispatched and was at my home in less than an hour. He confirmed the problem and assured he would be back today between 3 -5 pm. He did not disappoint. Ms Denise called at 3:33pm to let me know Jarrod was on the way.  My home is cool and comfortable again THANKS to the great team at Etheridge! Their service, expertise and professionalism is spot on. They will not disappoint.

Special thanks from my husband and I for everything!

name: John Byrd
text: The team was fast to respond and very responsibly priced

name: dcasey
text:
I called and spoke with Becky (could have been Rebecca) in the office. She was very patient with me as I explained what was going on with my unit. I later learned that she obviously had taken really good notes based on the phone conversation I had a day later with the technician (wish I'd gotten his name).
The unit in question is at my house that is for sale. The buyer's "inspector" (loosely used here) said the unit had a serious problem. I had the unit maintained twice per year (it is important to note that this twice yearly maintenance was not done by Ethridge) for each of the 10 years since the unit was installed so I didn't really believe that much could be wrong with it but was required to have it checked out.
After thoroughly inspecting and testing the unit, the Ethridige technician called to let me know the unit was fine, in fact he found no problems at all.
He could have easily gone with what the "inspector" said and the repairs or replacement could have made them a lot of money. But, this company chooses ethics and honesty and in doing so earned a customer.
I recommend this company and I plan to contact them for a maintenance contract for my home because I know these folks will not take advantage of me.

text: We exclusively use Ethridge for our HVAC needs. Andrew was very kind and prompt to the appointment. I highly recommend Ethridge

text: I desperately needed a new hvac system and Hembree did an amazing job! I had to finance it and it was so easy getting approved. The team showed up on time and did an amazing job. My new system works great and I’m beyond happy with everything from start to finish. Josh explained everything and I knew exactly what I was getting and how great the product is. I recommend them 100%!

name: Mark Engelmeyer
text:
During the quoting process for a  complete replacement Heat Pump for my 15 year old system we reached out to Hembree Heating & Air Conditioning.
They had been recommended to me from a neighbor.  We scheduled a time  to meet and discuss replacement options and quote the replacement system.  Madison called the morning of the estimate and Josh Hembree called, as promised, one hour prior to the meeting time.  Josh arrived on time and came prepared with all necessary information on a variety of systems available.  We were searching for a reliable system with an excellent warranty.  Josh offered an American Standard with an extended warranty through Hembree at a very fair and reasonable price.  The quote was under our budget which allowed us to step up to a 16 SEER system.  Overall, the quote for the 16 SEER system was less than any other quote we had received.  Josh schedule an install date for the following week.  Walt gave me a call on hour before the scheduled install.  Walt and Colin arrived on time to conduct the install as promised.  They were both very knowledgeable, friendly and professional.  The installation of the system was completed on time the day of starting the install. name: Octavio Garcia
text:
REVISED!!
A couple days after posting my review on google a technician got back with me. After a lengthy conversation he apologized for there mistakes as well as refunded me back my money. I truly do appreciate you guys refunding me my money but most importantly OFFERING AN APOLOGY. ANYBODY can make a mistake but is what you do after that matters. It showed me the kind of company you guys really are and I hope you continue that modus operandi. I would DEFINITELY give them another chance if I was to have another problem with my system.

I was told my burners or inducer motor was causing a rollout switch to trip. I question there call but they assure me it had to be either burners or inducer motor. Assuming they were professionals I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I even agree to maintenance plan which cost me a total $159. After x amount of days they came back to install the burners but was told the wrong item was shipped to them. I was later called and told they did not supply more parts for my unit due to its aged. That a NEW SYSTEM would be the best way to go OF COURSE THEY WOULD. I decided to take upon myself to look for parts. I came across some burners online and install them myself but problem was still there. ASSUMING THERE DIAGNOSTIC was right, I was about to order an inducer motor since I was TOLD it would either be burners or inducer motor. I decided check the system myself before I spend that kind of money on an inducer motor. SURPRISE SURPRISE after giving it a THOROUGH inspection I found a crack in the heat exchanger in a spot with no easy access that would have taken some PROPER DIAGNOSING that should’ve been no problem to them. I swap the heat exchanger myself and my furnace is running like a champ again. Even after I share the pictures with there technician NO REFUND, NO APOLOGY NO NOTHING was offer. VERY DISAPPOINTED other than there politeness when they came to my house  WORST EXPERIENCE EVER save your money  call someone else.

text: Tech was on time and did the work needed on the unit.  Didn't realize how low the freon was.  He refilled the freon and now it's making the unit cycle better and the house is more comfortable without working itself to death.

name: Ali D
text: Terrible, horrible, awful would not recommend to anyone.  Only one of the three technicians they sent out were competent.  Our AC was out one month June 14 - July 15 and they repeatedly misdiagnosed what was wrong with our ac and expected us to pay for their mistakes.  We are pretty sure they broke the ac coils (we didn't have problems before they messed with it) and they re-wired our thermostat incorrectly.  I had to call constantly to get updates and no one seemed to have a clue.  Customer service is poor to say the least.  Once we FINALLY got the ac fixed they wanted to dispute the invoice.  DO NOT HIRE MIDSOUTH TO DO ANY AC WORK!

name: Cross Fire
text: Great company, honest and so easy to deal with. I choose my contractors based on their personality and how they act.  Mid South was honest from the start and they were able to get out the next day to replace my coil.  I had several questions for the company who originally installed my 4 year old central AC unit (3D) and they dodged me like the plague which says so much about their business. Mid South was completely honest, very personable, friendly  and I could go on.  If you need hvac help call Mid South and don't waste your time with anyone else.

name: Brian Gullage
text:
$616............for 2 twenty dollar capacitors and a 15 minute service call.  So my previous 5 star review has changed.

I have been a very loyal customer of Midsouth, and I have recommended them to numerous people. I have always given them excellent reviews.

I know small businesses have high expenses and need to make a profit, but overcharging a loyal customer that sends you referrals has consequences.

resp.text:
Hello Mr Gullage,
I hope you are doing well. I just wanted to make a quick response to your negative feedback. We actually charged you 485.00 for (2) pounds of Freon and (2) capacitors. This is a very competitive price in our area for the service that was performed on your HVAC system.

We always give upfront pricing before any work is completed. You had the option to approve or decline the work  before any work was performed on your system. You approved the work order and then we made the needed repairs. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any more questions or concerns. You can contact our office @ (205)730-1270. As always, we appreciate your business!!!

We do our very best to stay as competitive as possible to help our customers.

name: Gene Cochran
text:
David Monk was my technician today serving 3 units in my house. 2 weeks ago I had a new roof put on my house. David went in to the attic and immediately discovered a roofing nail lodged into the copper natural gas line. It was spewing natural gas and we immediately turned all appliances off. It could have been disastrous! 20 years ago the builder placed the copper lines too close to the roof decking. We were very close to losing our house in a possible explosion!
David serviced all 3 units, cleaned the coils and gave me an overview of the expected life of each unit. He also gave me information on a finance plan if one or all of my units fail. 60 months with 0% interest really would be a great way to finance a complete unit.

Brown Heating & Cooling has been great for my family for 25 years now!

Thanks David Monk for your professional service!!!

resp.text: We love to hear stories like this and so happy David found the problem before something terrible happened. Thank you for your continued confidence in Brown!

name: Lane Hyche
text: I called Brown (Dec 4, 2019) because my heat pump was running nonstop when I went upstairs but it felt like it was cold. When Derek arrived, he immediately started gathering information about what kind of issues I was having and where. I told him about the upstairs being cold and he started with the outside before working his was to the second floor. We found that one of my attic doors had been left open by our pest control tech. Instead of stopping there, he verified that everything else was operating properly. Where others would have stopped, he wanted to make sure we didn't have another problem that may have been masked by the door being left open. He definitely went above and beyond with keeping my family comfortable. Thanks for the care you showed us.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Lane. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us—and we agree, Derek is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

text: I've been a Brown heating and cooling customer for around 4 years and never had a problem with the service. The techs always go check the system for any future problems. text: We unfortunately had to call Brown on a holiday due to a broken AC. name: BRIAN WELCH
text: Brown was very fast and responsive to my call.  The technician that came out was on time and very professional.  He explained all of my options very thoroughly for repairing or replacing my 15 year old unit in terms I could understand.  He made sure he answered each and every one of my questions.  I ended up choosing to replace the unit rather than sink money into costly repairs for such an old unit.  Brown was able to replace my unit with a new Bryant the same day.  They were very fast and efficient but I could tell they took pride in the job and did even the little things the right way.  The technician told me I would, but I have really noticed a difference in the energy savings on my power bill for the new unit.  I thought that might just be a sales pitch but I have saved money on my power bill because the new unit is so much more energy efficient.  I would not hesitate to recommend Brown to all of my friends and family.

name: Meredith Thigpen
text:
I can’t sing the praises of this company and Tina White, who is my Christmas angel.  My mom lives in Virginia mines and has been without heat or air for 4 years, which we haven’t been able to afford to replace. She was using space heaters all thru the house, which I know is oh so dangerous.  I’ve known Tina from my job, and when I found out that they offer a charity that provides heat for senior citizens, all I had to do was ask.  David, in the office, immediately called to set up a time to be there on Monday.  This was on Friday.  The technician was at my moms house by 8 am and worked all day and by 5 pm, the same day, my mom was calling and crying, because of the warmth.  I will never be able to repay the generosity of Tina and Brown heating, in Hueytown.  But, we will be paying it forward whenever we are able.  Thank you so much for everything you’ve done for me and my family.
Meredith Thigpen

name: Dane Benton
text:
Terrible workmanship paired with an equally repulsive attitude towards customers.

Our A/C unit died in August of 2017. Luckily, we had a warranty through Old Republic, which paid for a replacement unit. Unfortunately, however, the company that Old Republic required us to use for installation was 5 Star Heating and Air Conditioning out of Foley, AL.

Over the past year, we have experienced several issues with our new unit not cooling the house properly. About two months ago, we came home to soggy carpet and buckled wood floors due to the drain pipe for our unit overflowing. My father came by to take a look at the unit and noticed that the "Safe-T-Switch float valve", which cuts the unit off if the drain pipe clogs and fills up, was installed ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE UNIT, rendering it completely useless.

We called 5 Star and they did come out to the house and move the valve to the correct side without charging us, which we felt was the least they could do since their poor workmanship was the cause of this incident. Over the past few weeks, we noticed that our outside unit would randomly cut off during the day, making the house unbearable to be inside. We called 5 Star, and they let us know that it would be $100 to come out and take a look at it. At this point, I decided to call another company to come look at it rather than paying 5 Star.

The other Service Man came out and took a look at it and noticed that the inside of the pipe that the float valve was attached to was clogged with sealant, preventing the flow of water. (See attached photos) I'm no plumber, but I can tell you that when you put sealant inside the female coupling, and push the male part in, the sealant has nowhere to go but inside the pipe, which prevents the drain pipe from being able to drain water. He replaced the drain pipe, and put the float valve in the correct place, and amazingly, our A/C unit works like new!

I will be sure to let everyone know how much money my "no-cost warranty replacement" A/C unit has cost me thanks to 5 Star's sub-par work.

Photo 1 - Crazy Straw like drain pipe from 5 Star
Photo 2 - Sealant inside pipe (photo taken after I punched a large portion of the sealant out of the pipe)
Photo 3 - New drain pipe installed by another {competent} A/C Repair company

resp.text: Dane, we are sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with our options for maintenance. We felt that our repair of the float valve and drain line were sufficient in correcting the problem. We at 5 Star Air Conditioning pride ourselves on excellent workmanship, and truly hope that you understand our position with the 30 day warranty. Please remember proper maintenance is critical, and we are happy to hear that your A/C unit is working properly.

I recently had another issue and explained the problem to the receiptionist. She got a service tech to call me back (5 min) and he and I fixed the problem over the phone. Saved me the cost of a house call!

I would definitely call these guys for any and all AC/Heat repair. You won't be disappointed!

resp.text: That is great to hear Ralph! We love it when we are able to take care of our customers as soon as possible. Thank you for the 5 stars!

name: Jim Stewart
text: I have never been treated so well by any company, from start to finish. The phone was answered on the first ring and, when I explained my issue (a/c problem on a 100 degree day), Cindy said she would call me back when the next repair tech was available. She replied within 20 minutes and said the technician would be on site in less than an hour. He arrived in 30 minutes and immediately diagnosed the problem. It was a minor problem (for him) but a major one for me, and I was treated like I was the only customer he had all day. I would recommend 5 Star to anyone!

resp.text: Jim, thank you for the wonderful review. We are glad that we were able to fix your problem quickly and get you some relief in this heat. We appreciate the recommendation and glad to be of service!

name: Veslava F
text: They have always treated us like we were their only client and we love that about 5 Star AC

resp.text: Thanks for the review V

name: Kevin Gorman
text: I am very happy with 5 Star A/C

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

name: Jonathan McKenzie
text: 5 Star is an amazing company that TRULY cares about their customers and are absolute experts in their field. I can’t think of anything negative and I have used them for over 4.5 years. Thanks!!

resp.text: Jonathan, thank you for the wonderful review and being such a loyal customer. We appreciate the five stars!

name: Lewkutz Family
text: Couldn't ask for a better company! Tyler, Cindy and 5 Star Air Conditioning have done a great job for me since day 1. I wouldn't call another company. They have my business as long as I'm in Gulf Shores!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Andrew Hudson
text: 5 Star Air Conditioning is absolutely AMAZING!! Cindy is the most helpful person, she brightens up the day every time I call with a problem. Then there is Tyler, what a WONDERFUL person, so punctual, informative and honest! They are not out to take advantage of the people in need of HVAC repair, they are truly there to help, such a delightful change from most companies today! I would highly recommend them for any of your HVAC needs!

resp.text: Andrew, it is our pleasure to serve you. Thanks for the review :)

name: Kristan Croom
text:
I have Never been treated so poorly by a company in all my years. I've been in sales and customer service myself for 21 years and can not fathom treating someone the way that the owners treated me.  T actually told me he'd never seen his wife/co-owner treat anyone as poorly as she had me. He also said if you are not on her good side, she will make sure the installation is prolonged "like she did a customer in Point Clear." Well, he was honest about that!  BUT...
I was lied to, I was reprimanded on the phone, I was discriminated against, and was led on for 3 weeks and 4 days without Air Conditioning. My home warranty is conducting a detailed investigation and I hope They will never be able to do this to anyone again. They were cruel and vindictive.
The absolute lack of professionalism, maturity, and kindness is just disturbing.

name: Daniel Barrow
text: Called to ask if they sell parts. Innocent question. Lady who answered the phone said no. When I asked if she knew who around here would, she said nobody should. And that was as helpful as she was willing to be.

resp.text:
Hi, Mr. Barrow,

We apologize for the communication that you felt was not very helpful to your situation. We try to be as helpful and informational as possible while still running a business. The supply stores that we purchase materials from do not sell to the public and, we are truly sorry, that we can not be of additional assistance on who you can purchase from.

name: Ralph Hellmich
text: 5 Star did an outstanding installation of a new unit for me this past summer.  The employees were courteous and really fast.  Unfortunately my unit was in the Attic and it was very hot and a small space.  The installed unit is better in quality workmanship and ductwork than when I built my house with a new unit.   Outstanding work, great price, good equipment thx again ...Ralph G Hellmich

name: Judy Thurmond
text: I can't say enough wonderful things about 5 Star A/C. I can promise you you will not be disappointed with the service you will receive from Tyler, Cindy, and the rest of the crew at 5 Star A/C.  We have 5 condo's...4 in Gulf Shores and 1 in Orange Beach and for the past 5 years Tyler has serviced all of our units and done complete HVAC replacement in a few of our units. All service and replacement have been done in a prompt , courteous, and professional manner. Even our guest who have been in our condo's when we have had a/c problems have commented on how quickly they arrived, evaluated, and fixed the problem. You just can't find service like they provide anywhere else.  I would never consider using any other air conditioning company but 5 Star A/C!

resp.text: Judy, thank you for the wonderful review. We appreciate you being a loyal customer and look forward to many more years working together.

name: Ralph Hellmich
text: 5 Star did an outstanding installation of a new unit for me this past summer.  The employees were courteous and really fast.  Unfortunately my unit was in the Attic and it was very hot and a small space.  The installed unit is better in quality workmanship and ductwork than when I built my house with a new unit.   Outstanding work, great price, good equipment thx again ...Ralph G Hellmich

name: Rachel Johnson
text: Tyler and Cindy are always there to help! They have great customer service and took time to help me figure out the issues over the phone late at night. Thank you for taking care of our personal and business AC needs!

resp.text: Rachel, thank you so much! You are the best!

name: Brad Nicks
text:
5 Star Air Conditioning installed my new AC system with an outstanding professional crew that went beyond my expectations.
Tyler quoted me with 4 options, showed me the difference in SEER ratings, filled out my registration and completed my rebate for $600  with Baldwin County EMC.
I would highly recommend 5 Star for any service or replacement on an AC system.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Brad!

text:
The Higginbotham’s are Honest Hard working HVAC Tech with Integerty, I Love my Air Conditioning (Keep it at 68)  and The 5 Star comfort Club is a Must to keep us Comfortable on the Gulf Coast! Thank you for your Hard work Keeping me Cool!
#WherestheBOSS

resp.text: Timothy, we appreciate the great review! Let us know if we can help you at anytime. Thanks again!

name: Matt Trostel
text: My first two needs for an HVAC expert were emergencies and 5 Star came through for me each time.  Not only did the tech put in extra time to help me out, the bill didn't reflect the typically high costs of emergency work.  Sign them up as YOUR go-to HVAC experts.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We truly appreciate your business and kind words!

text: Technicians are great but the customer service and total lack of respect from the lady in the office is unnecessary.
